name: Swiss Chard
properties: Rich in vitamins A, C, and K
High in minerals including magnesium and potassium
Low in calories, high in nutrients
Can be used in place of spinach or kale
benefits: Supports healthy digestion with high fiber content
Rich in antioxidants that combat oxidative stress
Supports bone health with vitamin K
Aids in weight management due to low calorie density
synergies: Pairs well with beans and legumes for complete protein
Combines with garlic for enhanced cardiovascular benefits
Works with turmeric and spices for anti-inflammatory effects
Complements quinoa and whole grains in balanced meals
amount: 3-6 cups cooked or 6-9 cups raw per serving

quotes: 6 cups/150g coarsely chopped spinach or chard
This simple soup is so full of flavour, it tastes as if it took hours to make. Spinach, chard or other dark leafy greens may be substituted for the kale if desired.
Depending on the type of greens, this can take as few as 3 minutes (for chard or spinach) or 25 to 45 minutes (for kale or collards).
TURMERIC QUINOA AND RED BEANS WITH CAULIFLOWER AND CHARD
8 ounces/225g chard, kale or spinach, tough stems removed, chopped
